alert.note: Alert for Bristol Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 06 at 4:54AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS THIS WEEKEND ALONG WITH SNOW CHANGING TO RAIN... A powerful storm system moving into the Bering Sea will bring another round of very strong winds to coastal and interior Bristol Bay this weekend. Southeasterly winds will quickly increase this morning and remain strong through Sunday morning before diminishing Sunday afternoon. For the Bristol Bay coast, expect sustained winds of 30 to 45 mph with gusts up to 55 mph possible. For interior Bristol Bay, expect sustained winds of 35 to 50 mph with gusts up to 65 mph possible. The winds are then expected to diminish by Sunday evening as the low lifts into the Bering Strait. A brief period of snow is likely this morning. However, temperatures will quickly warm into the mid to upper 30s as the winds increase, changing any snow over to rain.
